output.dependency: The style of the beer (e.g., 'Saison / Farmhouse Ale', 'Belgian IPA') likely correlates with the name of the beer (e.g., 'Tropical Saison', 'Nuit Serpent'). The beer style provides additional context or classification for the beer name.

The alcohol content format (percent) in one column indicates a pattern or rule to the volume description which is represented in ounces in another column. The alcohol percentage is usually related to the volume of the beer.
The brewery name (e.g., 'Brewery Vivant') suggests that all listed beers originate from the same location (e.g., 'Grand Rapids'). This implies a relationship between the brewery and its location.
The city (e.g., 'Grand Rapids') is associated with the state (e.g., 'MI'). This shows a geographic dependency where the city name indicates the state it is located in.
